projectPurpose: To provide a feature-rich command-line utility for Arch Linux users to easily manage packages from the Arch User Repository (AUR) and official repositories, acting as a wrapper around pacman.
mainFeatures: Interactive search and install for AUR and repository packages
Handles AUR dependencies and build process
PKGBUILD review and editing with optional syntax highlighting
Supports local repositories and clean chroot builds

alternatives.name: Pamac
mainFeatures: Supports official repositories, AUR, Flatpak, and Snap
Easy search, install, remove, and update

marketPositioning: Paru is positioned as a modern, feature-packed command-line AUR helper and pacman wrapper for Arch Linux, serving as a primary alternative to the popular 'yay'. It differentiates itself by being written in Rust, offering potentially better performance and memory safety, and by implementing 'saner' default behaviors such as requiring PKGBUILD review. It targets Arch Linux users comfortable with the command line who seek an efficient, comprehensive, and actively maintained tool for managing packages from both official repositories and the AUR.
